span.strong: Please see the menu bar to the left for details about meal service locations and times

a.title: Go to comments for Meals During the School Closure

span.p: They will be mailed out on Monday April 20th with student report cards.
If you have any questions please call 505-384-2004.

a.title: Go to comments for Spring Pictures

span.strong: Student Homework Packets will be available for pickup every Monday from 11 am-12 pm
at Elementary, Middle School, and High School offices.

a.title: Go to comments for Homework Packets

span.h1: Please click here for instructions on
how to fix the laptops that were picked up on 4/2/20

a.title: Go to comments for Laptop Solution

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: 2020 Census

strong.span: The 2020 Census data helps our community secure funding for schools, healthcare, highway planning, emergency response, and much more!
The data retrieved from this survey will have a huge impact on our finances for the next decade! Have you submitted your household data yet?
The survey can be completed online, over the phone, or via mail.
Visit The Census Bureau Webpage today for more information or to complete your survey.

p.strong: Nellie Gomez has officially retired from our district.

Nellie served in multiple capacities for countless years and we are shattered to see her go. We can't thank her enough for the difference she made in our community through our students.This woman truly has a heart of gold!

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: BPA

p.strong: We took 33 kids to the State Competition and out of those 33, 24 of them walked the stage, which means they were in the top 10 of their events! This is an AMAZING number. We are so proud of all of the kids! We had students compete in everything from Parliamentary Procedure to Virtual Photography to Medical Office Procedures. Our Parliamentary Procedure Team which consisted of Colin Pope, Adylay Bustillos, Payton Otis, Bianca Rivera-Noblitt, Isaac Ayers, Brandon Chavarria, and Catherine Anaya earned a cool 2nd place in the state while Alayna Thomas earned a 5th place in Fundamental Word Processing. Bianca Rivera-Noblitt earned a 3rd place in Interview Skills and Isaac Ayers earned a 2nd place in Extemporaneous Speech. Totiana Valdez also earned a First Place and Adylay Bustillos is now a STATE OFFICER😊😊😊

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: Drama Group

span.h4: We are so proud of our students!

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: Drama set

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: ffa

h4.span: On Thursday, January 9, the Estancia FFA traveled to Fort Collins, CO to compete in the Western National Meats Judging contest. Our team was 5th in the nation overall at this contest! Jonathan Aday was 6th individual, Natalio Hernandez was 14th,Ambros Kelly was 20th and Isaac Ayers was 21st. In the placing portion of the contest Isaac Ayers was 1st, Jonathan Aday was 6th and the Estancia team was 1st.
We are so proud of this team! Keep up the good work!
Pictured (from left to right) Mr. Harbert, Natalio Hernandez, Ambros Kelly, Isaac Ayers, Jonathan Aday, and Arliss Corliss.

a.title: Go to comments for FFA Competition
Go to comments for 100th Win for Coach Pierce

span.div: Call 505-384-2006 or contact your child's teacher directly. We will work to get back to you by the next business day
